XRSession.summary: NOTE Experimental The XRSession interface of the WebXR Device API represents an ongoing XR session, providing methods and properties used to interact with and control the session. To open a WebXR session, use the interface's method.

remarks.para: With XRSession methods, you can poll the viewer's position and orientation (the ), gather information about the user's environment, and present imagery to the user. XRSession supports both inline and immersive virtual and augmented reality modes.

XRSessionInputsourceschange.summary: NOTE Experimental The inputsourceschange event is sent to an when the set of available WebXR input devices changes.

XRSessionEnabledFeatures.summary: NOTE Experimental The interface's read-only enabledFeatures property returns an array of features enabled (granted) for an XRSession. This contains all requiredFeatures and a subset of optionalFeatures that have been requested with .

remarks.para:
-
-Session features

XRSessionSelect.summary: NOTE Experimental The WebXR select event is sent to an when one of the session's input sources has completed a primary action.

remarks.para: The is fired before this event and can prevent this event from being raised.

- and
-

XRSessionRequestReferenceSpace.summary:
NOTE Experimental The requestReferenceSpace() method of the
interface returns a {{JSxRef("promise")}} that resolves with
an instance of either
or as appropriate given the type of reference
space requested.
XRSessionRequestReferenceSpace.returns: A {{JSxRef("Promise")}} that resolves with an object.The types of reference space are listed below, with brief information about their use cases and which interface is used to implement them.

XRSessionDepthDataFormat.summary:
NOTE Experimental The read-only depthDataFormat property of an immersive-ar
describes which depth sensing data format is used.
XRSessionDepthDataFormat.value: This property can return the following values:

XRSessionSelectstart.summary: NOTE Experimental The WebXR selectstart event is sent to an when the user begins a primary action on one of its input sources.

remarks.para: The is fired before this event and can prevent this event from being raised.

- and
-

XRSessionInteractionMode.summary:
NOTE Experimental The interface's read-only interactionMode property
describes the best space (according to the user agent) for the application to draw an interactive UI for the current session.
XRSessionInteractionMode.value:
A string describing the best space (according to the user agent) for the application to draw an interactive UI
for the current session.Possible values are:

XRSessionVisibilitychange.summary: NOTE Experimental The visibilitychange event is sent to an to inform it when it becomes visible or hidden, or when it becomes visible but not currently focused. Upon receiving the event, you can check the value of the session's property to determine the new visibility state.

XRSessionRequestHitTestSourceForTransien.summary:
NOTE Experimental The requestHitTestSourceForTransientInput() method of the
interface returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with an object that can be passed to .
XRSessionRequestHitTestSourceForTransien.returns: A {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with an object.

XRSessionRenderState.summary:
NOTE Experimental The
read-only renderState property of an
object indicates the returns a
object describing how the user's environment which should be rendered. The
information provided covers the minimum and maximum distance at which to render objects,
the vertical field of view to use when rendering the in the inline session
mode, and the to render into for inline composition.

remarks.para:
While this property is read only, you can call the method
to make changes.

XRSessionRenderState.value: An object describing how to render the scene.

XRSessionInputSources.summary:
NOTE Experimental The read-only inputSources property of the
interface returns an object
which lists all controllers and input devices which are expressly associated with the
XR device and are currently available. These controllers may include handheld
controllers, XR-equipped gloves, optically tracked hands, and gaze-based input methods.
Keyboards, gamepads, and mice are not considered WebXR input sources.

blockquote.para: Traditional gamepad controllers are supported using the Gamepad API.

remarks.para:
-
-The event
-Gamepad API

XRSessionInputSources.value:
An object listing all of the currently-connected
input controllers which are linked specifically to the XR device currently in use. The
returned object is live; as devices are connected to and removed from
the user's system, the list's contents update to reflect the changes.

XRSessionUpdateRenderState.summary: NOTE Experimental The updateRenderState() method of the interface of the WebXR API schedules changes to be applied to the active render state () prior to rendering of the next frame.

remarks.para:
-WebXR Device API
-
-

XRSessionSqueezestart.summary: NOTE Experimental The WebXR event squeezestart is sent to an when the user begins a primary squeeze action on one of its input sources.

remarks.para: Primary squeeze actions are actions which are meant to represent gripping or squeezing using your hands, and may be simulated using triggers on hand controllers.

XRSessionVisibilityState.summary:
NOTE Experimental The read-only visibilityState property of the
interface is a string indicating whether the WebXR content is
currently visible to the user, and if it is, whether it's the primary focus.

remarks.para:
Every time the visibility state changes, a
event is fired on the
object.
- event

XRSessionVisibilityState.value:
A string indicating whether or not the XR content is
visible to the user and if it is, whether or not it's currently the primary focus.The possible values of visibilityState are:

XRSessionSelectend.summary: NOTE Experimental The WebXR event selectend is sent to an when one of its input sources ends its primary action or when an input source that's in the process of handling an ongoing primary action is disconnected without successfully completing the action.

remarks.para: The is fired before this event and can prevent this event from being raised.

- and
-

XRSessionRequestAnimationFrame.summary:
NOTE Experimental The
method requestAnimationFrame(), much like the
method of the same name, schedules a callback to be executed the
next time the browser is ready to paint the session's virtual environment to the XR
display. The specified callback is executed once before the next repaint; if
you wish for it to be executed for the following repaint, you must
call requestAnimationFrame() again. This can be done from within the
callback itself.

remarks.para:
The callback takes two parameters as inputs: an describing the
state of all tracked objects for the session, and a timestamp you can use to compute
any animation updates needed.

You can cancel a previously scheduled animation by calling
.

blockquote.para:
Despite the obvious similarities between these methods and the
global function
provided by the Window interface, you must not treat these as
interchangeable. There is no guarantee that the latter will work at all while
an immersive XR session is underway.

XRSessionRequestAnimationFrame.returns:
An integer value which serves as a unique, non-zero ID or handle you may pass to
if you need to
remove the pending animation frame request.

XRSessionSqueezeend.summary: NOTE Experimental The WebXR event squeezeend is sent to an when one of its input sources ends its primary action or when an input source that's in the process of handling an ongoing primary action is disconnected without successfully completing the action.

remarks.para: Primary squeeze actions include things like users pressing triggers or buttons, tapping a touchpad, speaking a command, or performing a recognizable gesture when using a video tracking system or handheld controller with an accelerometer.

XRSessionEnd.summary:
NOTE Experimental The end() method shuts down the
on which it's called, returning a promise which resolves once
the session has fully shut down.
XRSessionEnd.returns:
A that resolves without a value after any platform-specific steps
related to shutting down the session have completed. You can use the promise to do
things like update UI elements to reflect the shut down connection, trigger application
shut down, or whatever else you might need to do.

XRSessionDomOverlayState.summary:
NOTE Experimental The read-only domOverlayState property of an immersive-ar
provides information about the DOM overlay, if the feature is enabled.
XRSessionDomOverlayState.value: Returns null if the DOM overlay feature is not supported or not enabled or an object containing information about the DOM overlay state with the following properties:

XRSessionRequestHitTestSource.summary:
NOTE Experimental The requestHitTestSource() method of the
interface returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with an object that can be passed to .
XRSessionRequestHitTestSource.returns: A {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with an object.

XRSessionEnvironmentBlendMode.summary:
NOTE Experimental The interface's read-only environmentBlendMode
property identifies if, and to what degree, the computer-generated imagery is overlaid atop the real world.

remarks.para:
This is used to differentiate between fully-immersive VR sessions and AR sessions which render
over a pass-through image of the real world, possibly partially transparently.

XRSessionEnvironmentBlendMode.value: A string defining if and how virtual, rendered content is overlaid atop the image of the real world.Possible values are:

XRSessionPreferredReflectionFormat.summary: NOTE Experimental The read-only preferredReflectionFormat property of the interface returns this session's preferred reflection format used for lighting estimation texture data.
XRSessionPreferredReflectionFormat.value:
A string representing the reflection format. Possible values:
XRReflectionFormatWebGL FormatWebGL Internal FormatWebGPU FormatHDR
"srgba8"RGBASRGB8_ALPHA8"rgba8unorm-srgb"
"rgba16f"RGBARGBA16F"rgba16float"âœ“

XRSessionCancelAnimationFrame.summary:
NOTE Experimental The cancelAnimationFrame() method of
the interface cancels an animation frame which was previously
requested by calling .

XRSessionSqueeze.summary: NOTE Experimental The WebXR squeeze event is sent to an when one of the session's input sources has completed a primary squeeze action. Examples of common kinds of primary action are users pressing triggers or buttons, tapping a touchpad, speaking a command, or performing a recognizable gesture when using a video tracking system or handheld controller with an accelerometer.

remarks.para: For details on how the , squeeze, and events work, and how you should react to them, see Inputs and input sources.
- and event

XRSessionRequestLightProbe.summary:
NOTE Experimental The requestLightProbe() method of the
interface returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with an object that estimates lighting information at a given point in the user's environment.
XRSessionRequestLightProbe.returns: A {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with an object.

XRSessionEnd.summary: NOTE Experimental An end event is fired at an object when the WebXR session has ended, either because the web application has chosen to stop the session, or because the {{Glossary("user agent")}} terminated the session.

XRSessionDepthUsage.summary:
NOTE Experimental The read-only depthUsage property of an immersive-ar
describes which depth-sensing usage is used.
XRSessionDepthUsage.value: This property can return the following values:
